sandy.core.data.UVCoord

type
class
A 2D coordinate point on a texture that corresponds to a vertex of a polygon.

The UVCoord represents the position of a vertex on the Bitmap used to "dress" a polygon.
It is the 2D texture coordinate, used in the BitmapMaterial and VideoMaterial.

@author Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou @author Niel Drummond - haXe port @author Russell Weir - haXe port @since 0.3 @version 3.1 @date 24.08.2007

Constructor

new(?p_nU : Float, ?p_nV : Float)
parameters:
p_nU Float the x texture position in the bitmap
p_nV Float the y texture position in the bitmap.
Creates a new UV coordinate.

Instance Variables

u : Float

The v coordinate.

v : Float

The u coordinate.

Instance Methods

add(p_oUV : UVCoord) : Void

parameters:
p_oUV The UVCoord to add.
Adds the specified UV coordinate from this UV coordinate.

clone() : UVCoord

returns:
A new UVCoord object that is identical to the original.
Returns a new UVCoord object that is a clone of the original instance.

copy(p_oUV : UVCoord) : Void

parameters:
p_oUV The vertex to copy.
Makes this UV coordinate a copy of the specified UV coordinate.

All components of the specified UV coordinate are copied to this UV coordinate.

length() : Float

The length.

normalize() : Void

Normalizes this UV coordinate.

A UV coordinate is normalized when its components are divided by its length. The length is calculated by Math.sqrt( u*u + v*v ).

scale(p_nFactor : Float) : Void

parameters:
p_nFactor The factor.
Scales the texture coordinates by a factor.

sub(p_oUV : UVCoord) : Void

parameters:
p_oUVCoord The UVCoord to substract
Substract the UVCoord passed as parameter to the current UVCoord.

toString() : String

returns:
The fully qualified name of this object.
Returns a string representation of this object.
